messages.subject: Maria CLine---Re: Inoue Genzaburou / Itou/Shimada K/ Ichimura
messages.msgSnippet: 99.99% of us can t read japanese either but if you go to the the nifty translator (top url) and cut & paste in the bottom url in the url space provided (then
messages.messageBody:
99.99% of us can't read japanese either but if you go to the the nifty
translator (top url) and cut & paste in the bottom url in the url space
provided (then choose the bottom option in drop down menu directly
below) You will get a semi-understandable translation along with the
original Japanese text.

Admittedly our intrepid Secretary is the only one who seems to actually
enjoy this activity but many of us mere mortals can get a vague idea of
what they're saying much of the time.

Maria Cline wrote:

>Great. Now, I just wish I can read Japanese!
>
>>according to hino-shinsengumi
>>(via http://www.nifty.com/globalgate)
>>http://8614.teacup.com/hijikata/bbs
>>
>>
>>
>>
>
>
>
>

--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net

> http://8614.teacup.com/hijikata/bbs
> Since the "short blade of source Saburo of Inoue"
> currently exhibited
>
> Nov. 18 a memorial will be held fo Todou Heisuke and
> Itou
>
> ----------------------------
>
> I would also like to call your attention to
> http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp/bakumatu_fubou.htm
> because not only does it mention that detail about
> Fujita Goro
> teaching kenjutsu (see my previous post) it also has
> a part about
> Shimada Kai making bean paste soup and
> mochi?....Does he cook ? (^_^)
>
> ----------------------------
> http://pa.orange-e.net/?id=g1342122
> as well as other messageboards in Japanese have
> continuously mentioned
> things about historical Tetsu Ichimura these past
> few months...now
> there seems to be an exhibit with all the gathered
> info/material
>

Great. Now, I just wish I can read Japanese!

Maria

messages.subject: Inoue Genzaburou / Itou/Shimada K/ Ichimura
messages.msgSnippet: according to hino-shinsengumi (via http://www.nifty.com/globalgate) http://8614.teacup.com/hijikata/bbs Since the short blade of source Saburo of Inoue
messages.messageBody:
according to hino-shinsengumi
(via http://www.nifty.com/globalgate) http://8614.teacup.com/hijikata/bbs
Since the "short blade of source Saburo of Inoue" currently exhibited

Nov. 18 a memorial will be held fo Todou Heisuke and Itou

----------------------------

I would also like to call your attention to
http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp/bakumatu_fubou.htm
because not only does it mention that detail about Fujita Goro
teaching kenjutsu (see my previous post) it also has a part about
Shimada Kai making bean paste soup and mochi?....Does he cook ? (^_^)

----------------------------
http://pa.orange-e.net/?id=g1342122
as well as other messageboards in Japanese have continuously mentioned
things about historical Tetsu Ichimura these past few months...now
there seems to be an exhibit with all the gathered info/material
